meanings.definition: Highly unpleasant, especially in taste or smell.
meanings.sent1: The spoiled milk had a nasty smell.
meanings.sent2: The garbage left out for days started to smell nasty.
meanings.sent3: The prankster put a nasty-smelling cheese in the office fridge.
meanings.sent4: The stagnant water in the pond had a nasty stench that lingered.
meanings.sent5: The rotten eggs emitted a truly nasty odor.

meanings.sent1: She gave me a nasty look after I accidentally bumped into her.
meanings.sent2: The bully made nasty comments to intimidate others.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave a nasty glare to the dog invading its territory.
meanings.sent4: His words were as sharp and nasty as a thorn.
meanings.sent5: The villain's plan was full of nasty intentions.

meanings.sent1: The kitchen floor was covered in nasty grease stains.
meanings.sent2: The public restroom was so nasty that nobody wanted to use it.
meanings.sent3: The muddy dog left nasty paw prints all over the carpet.
meanings.sent4: The old sponge had become a breeding ground for nasty bacteria.
meanings.sent5: The neglected alley was filled with all sorts of nasty debris.
